original_solution_mapping.L1: Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=24>>24.
original_solution_mapping.L2: On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 24 / 3 = <<24/3=8>>8.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So at the end of day three, he has 24 - 8 = <<24-8=16>>16 fish.
original_solution_mapping.L4: On day five he has 16 * 2 * 2 = 64 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
original_solution_mapping.L6: So at the end of day five, he has 64 - 16 = <<64-16=48>>48 fish.
original_solution_mapping.L7: On day seven he has 48 * 2 * 2 = <<48*2*2=192>>192 fish.
original_solution_mapping.L8: He adds in 15 more, so he has 192 + 15 = <<192+15=207>>207 fish in total.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1802.
    Returns: the total number of fish Jason has.
    """
    # L1
    initial_fish = 6 # Jason has six fish
    doubling_factor = 2 # the number of fish doubles
    fish_day_3_before_removal = initial_fish * doubling_factor * doubling_factor

    # L2
    removal_divisor_day_3 = 3 # one-third of the fish
    fish_removed_day_3 = fish_day_3_before_removal / removal_divisor_day_3

    # L3
    fish_end_day_3 = fish_day_3_before_removal - fish_removed_day_3

    # L4
    fish_day_5_before_removal = fish_end_day_3 * doubling_factor * doubling_factor

    # L5
    removal_divisor_day_5 = 4 # one-fourth of the fish
    fish_removed_day_5 = fish_day_5_before_removal / removal_divisor_day_5

    # L6
    fish_end_day_5 = fish_day_5_before_removal - fish_removed_day_5

    # L7
    fish_day_7_before_addition = fish_end_day_5 * doubling_factor * doubling_factor

    # L8
    added_fish_day_7 = 15 # adds 15 more fish
    total_fish = fish_day_7_before_addition + added_fish_day_7

    # FA
    answer = total_fish
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day {initial_fish} * {doubling_factor} * {doubling_factor} = <<{initial_fish}*{doubling_factor}*{doubling_factor}={fish_day_3_before_removal}>>{fish_day_3_before_removal}.

On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish {fish_day_3_before_removal} / {removal_divisor_day_3} = <<{fish_day_3_before_removal}/{removal_divisor_day_3}={fish_removed_day_3}>>{fish_removed_day_3}.
So at the end of day three, he has {fish_day_3_before_removal} - {fish_removed_day_3} = <<{fish_day_3_before_removal}-{fish_removed_day_3}={fish_end_day_3}>>{fish_end_day_3} fish.
On day five he has {fish_end_day_3} * {doubling_factor} * {doubling_factor} = {fish_day_5_before_removal} fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
So at the end of day five, he has {fish_day_5_before_removal} - {fish_removed_day_5} = <<{fish_day_5_before_removal}-{fish_removed_day_5}={fish_end_day_5}>>{fish_end_day_5} fish.
On day seven he has {fish_end_day_5} * {doubling_factor} * {doubling_factor} = <<{fish_end_day_5}*{doubling_factor}*{doubling_factor}={fish_day_7_before_addition}>>{fish_day_7_before_addition} fish.
He adds in {added_fish_day_7} more, so he has {fish_day_7_before_addition} + {added_fish_day_7} = <<{fish_day_7_before_addition}+{added_fish_day_7}={total_fish}>>{total_fish} fish in total.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=24>>24.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 24 / 3 = <<24/3=8>>8.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So at the end of day three, he has 24 - 2 = <<24-2=22>>22 fish.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: On day five he has 22 * 2 * 2 = 88 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: So at the end of day five, he has 88 - 22 = <<88-22=66>>66 fish.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L7: On day seven he has 66 * 2 * 2 = <<66*2*2=264>>264 fish.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L8: He adds in 15 more, so he has 264 + 15 = <<264+15=279>>279 fish in total.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'doubling_factor' (value: 2) was used instead of 'fish_removed_day_3' (value: 8.0).
